Hospital.Schedules.Constraints.XRayConstraint

Class XRayConstraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital.Schedules.SchedulableVisitor
      • Hospital.Schedules.TimeFrameConstraint

  • public class XRayConstraint
extends TimeFrameConstraint
    The constraint imposed on scheduling by X-ray scans

        public XRayConstraint(int wantToDo)

        Throws:
        ArgumentConstraintException - wantToDo was negative

    • Method Detail

      • setPatient

        public void setPatient(Patient p)
        (in)validates the constraint based on a given TimeFrame for a Patient.
        Will result in invalidation if scheduling the in the constructor given amount of X-ray scans at the given timeframe would result in the patient getting more than MAX_XRAY_COUNT scans in the span of a year
        Overrides:
        setPatient in class SchedulableVisitor
        Parameters:
        p - the Patient-object
        See Also:
        Hospital.Schedules.Constraints.TimeFrameConstraint#setValidPatient(Hospital.Schedules.TimeFrame, Hospital.Patient.Patient)

      • isAccepted

        public Time isAccepted()
        Description copied from class: TimeFrameConstraint
        Check whether the Constraint is accepted. If the TimeFrame is not valid, the first known valid TimeFrame must be returned, if no TimeFrame can be predicted, the next minute is returned. A ScheduleConstraintException is thrown if there will never be a valid TimeFrame. Note, if this can't be predicted you may have an infinite loop.
        Specified by:
        isAccepted in class TimeFrameConstraint
        Returns:
        the last timeFrame itself, if valid the first open TimeFrame if invalid and known the next minute, if invalid and unknown null if information was missing
